newsitem.title: USA: Royal Silver options Argentina mine claims.
newsitem.headline: Royal Silver options Argentina mine claims.

text.p: Royal Silver Mines Inc on Monday said it has acquired an option to purchase 12 separate claim groups covering some 15,000 acres in the northwestern La Rioja province of Argentina.
Under the terms of the deal, Royal Silver can purchase the properties on or before March 1, 2000, by paying $4.5 million in cash or $5.5 million in Royal Silver common shares.

The properties include Precambrian stratiform copper-silver prospects, several classic porphyry copper-molybdenum prospects, and a Mississippi Valley-type silver-lead-zinc prospect, Royal Silver said in a statement.
The majority of these claims have already been converted to full mine status, which conveys full ownership of minerals, under Argentina's mining law.
The original owners also will retain a 1.9 percent net smelter return royalty on future production. During the option period, Royal Silver will be committed to ongoing work on the property.
